head.title: Queens Boy Injured By a Stray Bullet

hedline.hl1: Queens Boy Injured By a Stray Bullet

abstract.p: Binnay Rodriguez, 11, is wounded by stray bullet fired during gang fight in Queens, New York City (S)

block.p: An 11-year-old boy walking home from school on Friday was wounded by a stray bullet fired during a fight between two gangs on a major Queens thoroughfare, the police said yesterday.

The youngster was on his way home from Public School 86 in the Briarwood section of Queens about 3:30 p.m. Friday when he was shot in front of 87-85 Parsons Boulevard, near Hillside Avenue, the police said.
An 11-year-old boy walking home from school on Friday was wounded by a stray bullet fired during a fight between two gangs on a major Queens thoroughfare, the police said yesterday.

The youngster was on his way home from Public School 86 in the Briarwood section of Queens about 3:30 p.m. Friday when he was shot in front of 87-85 Parsons Boulevard, near Hillside Avenue, the police said.

The boy, Binnay Rodriguez, who lives a few blocks from where he was shot, was taken to St. Vincents Medical Center-Mary Immaculate Division, where he was listed in stable condition. A small-caliber bullet lodged in soft tissue just beneath the skin in his neck.

''He's quite lucky,'' said Dr. Neil M. Richards, the hospital's director of trauma surgery. He said the boy would probably be released today. '' He's a brave little tough guy, but very respectful,'' Dr. Richards said.

Detectives canvassed the area where the shooting had occurred. They said they believed that it had stemmed from a dispute between two gangs, the Latin Kings and another group called Money Over Bitches, or M.O.B. Two .22-caliber shell casings were found. The incident is being investigated by detectives from the 103rd Precinct and the gang investigation division.
